task.title: Construction Lines
task.shortdesc: A construction line is a line through a given point, oriented at a specified angle in three-dimensional space and extending to infinity in both directions. Because construction lines extend to infinity, they are not calculated as part of the drawing extents.

context.p: The default method for drawing a construction line is to select a point along the line and then specify the direction of the line. You can draw a construction line in any of the following ways:

ul.li: Horizontal draws the construction line parallel to the x-axis of the current UCS.
Vertical draws the construction line parallel to the y-axis of the current UCS.
Angle draws the construction line parallel to a specified angle.
Bisect draws the construction line perpendicular to an existing object.
Parallel draws the construction line parallel to an existing object.

step.cmd: Choose Draw > Construction Line from the mainmenu.
Specify a point along the line.

step.info: To complete the command, press Enter.

result.p: The point along the infinite line (A) and the direction (B)
You can also draw a construction line at a specific angle or at an angle relative to an existing object.
